Notion is my favourite app for making planners and organizing school, especially as a homeschooled student. You can create cozy, cute planners, schedules, and study pages all in one place and decorate them however you like. At first, i was a little confused and hard to understand because there are many options, (â•¥ï¹â•¥) but once i got used to it, it became rlly helpful and comfortable to use. (Ë¶áµ” áµ• áµ”Ë¶) !

They just don't want to fix this critical bug that makes their app totally useless on my phone.

Being tech savvy, I can't remember the last time I've been this frustrated with a mobile app. Selecting a function & formatting takes FOREVER. Love the template availability & reviews are amazing, but it's time to move on

Notion is not just a productivity app â€” itâ€™s a system for thinking clearly. Iâ€™ve tried almost every popular tool: Google Docs, Trello, Evernote, OneNote, Asana â€” and all of them feel limited once you use Notion properly. Those apps force you into predefined workflows. Notion does the opposite: it adapts to how you think and work. What makes Notion powerful is how everything connects. Notes, tasks, projects, calendars, goals, knowledge â€” all live in one place, fully linked, searchable, and custom
Has this app been abandoned? Even basic features like pasting images don't work...

Notion AI has evolved from a simple writer into a full-blown productivity partner. The new "Custom Agents" for automating database workflows are absolute magicâ€”they save me hours of manual tagging. The AI search is incredibly fast, even when digging through old PDFs. While the mobile app still takes a second to load complex pages, the ability to "Chat with Claude 4" directly inside my notes makes it an unbeatable all-in-one workspace. Itâ€™s the smartest way to stay organized right now!

From 5 Stars to 2. Evernote is reliable, fast, simple, and enjoyable - I happily paid $129/year. But.... now basic app functionality is locked behind $249-$299/yea. Let me be real, their $99-$179 starter plan is a trap. How long do you think until you hit just ONE of these limits: You need more than (a tiny) 1GB of storage? You need more than 20 folders (called notebooks)? You need to sync your notes across 4 devices? You will be forced to upgrade to $299.

One of the most disappointing apps I have ever used. I've had this app for years and have always experienced headaches, from poor UI functionality to delayed response times to incessant pop-ups and ads. Now it limits the "features" I can use unless I pay a monthly subscription for an app that TAKES NOTES (barely). Uninstalled and deleted my profile, transitioned the useful notes I had left to a different app. For those looking, just use BlackNote. Much simpler, no hassle, and free.

If I could give this app worse than a 1 I would. I signed up for the free trial and it is extremely difficult to figure out how to cancel the subscription. I have to cancel it from the Evernote website. But get this, the Evernote website won't load!! The website comes up, I attempt to login, and immediately a never ending load screen.
